title: Sold now, cheers! 1966 RHD Walkthrough 11 Window Bus

posts.content:
1966 Right Hand Drive, Walkthrough 11 Window Bus For Sale

MOT until March 2016

Lowered on a Slamwerks 4 inch narrowed beam with dropped spindles up front & a straight axel conversion to the rear

1776 engine with full flow oil & external filter, engle cam & twin Dellorto 34 Carbs.

Drum brakes all round, but has a servo fitted, so stops very well.

Interior has a rock n roll bed & new ply panels. MP3/CD Stereo, with 6x9 speakers.

Bodywork is pretty good for its age & has had a few repairs over the years, as you would expect on a UK Bus.

The bus has no outstanding MOT advisories & is ready to drive away.

I have owned this bus for 7 years & it has taken us all over the Uk, to Spa in Belgium & all the way to Wolfsburg. It has always been very reliable & well looked after.

A great Bus ready for a new owner to enjoy.

We are based near Redruth in Cornwall

£18.950

Anymore details what is the underneath like?

SEE YA wrote:Anymore details what is the underneath like?


Hi, underside is all good. Will drop you a PM.
Cheers

Dougie wrote:PM on it's way....very interested


Nice one, PM replied to

Cheers
Thanks for the extra photos, see you on Sunday

Dougie wrote:Thanks for the extra photos, see you on Sunday


No worries buddy, see you then!
Thanks again Marc, the van is a credit to you , it didn't miss a beat all 250 miles home despite an hour of tailback on the A30 and torrential rain from Taunton to Bristol.

Nice one Dougie
Hopefully see her at Busfest.

This seems like it a nice Bus sold for a sensible price. Just back from Camperjam and had to log on to see if the world had gone mad or just Some sellers and eBay.

Hopefully the buyer and seller are both happy, that's how it should be

No worries Dougie.
Glad you had a good trip home, indpite of the weather...
Hope you enjoy him as much as we have.
All the best
Marc

Dougie wrote:Thanks again Marc, the van is a credit to you , it didn't miss a beat all 250 miles home despite an hour of tailback on the A30 and torrential rain from Taunton to Bristol.
